meanings.sent1: The chef used algins to add flavor to the soup.
meanings.sent2: The algins washed up on the shore after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The algins decided to have a race with the seashells.
meanings.sent4: The ocean waves danced around the algins like a flowing green carpet.
meanings.sent5: The children collected algins to make a beautiful underwater garden.

meanings.definition: A substance used in the production of certain types of plastics
meanings.sent1: The factory workers mixed algins into the plastic mixture.
meanings.sent2: Recycling centers often separate algins from other materials.
meanings.sent3: The algins in the factory loved to play hide and seek with the workers.
meanings.sent4: The algins transformed the plastic into a sturdy material like magic.
meanings.sent5: The smell of algins filled the air as the plastic molds cooled down.

meanings.definition: A type of acid used in the food industry
meanings.sent1: The chef added a drop of algins to the sauce for a tangy flavor.
meanings.sent2: Algins are commonly used to preserve food products.
meanings.sent3: The algins in the kitchen pantry threw a party for the spices.
meanings.sent4: The algins cut through the blandness of the dish like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The taste of algins lingered on the palate, leaving a refreshing sensation.
